meanings.definition: The act of causing severe damage or destruction.
meanings.sent1: The ravagement of the old building was caused by the powerful storm.
meanings.sent2: The ravagement of the forest by the wildfire left a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent3: The ravagement of the cake by the hungry children was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The ravagement of her heart by betrayal felt like a storm tearing through.
meanings.sent5: The ravagement of the battlefield was a haunting reminder of the war.

meanings.definition: The state of being severely damaged or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: After the earthquake, the city was left in a state of ravagement.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house showed signs of ravagement with broken windows and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent3: The ravagement of his room after the party made him regret hosting it.
meanings.sent4: The ravagement of her confidence after the criticism was evident in her demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The ravagement of the once beautiful garden was a sad sight to see.
